articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Over the weekend, High Times hosted another Cannabis Cup in San Bernardino, where growers, breeders, extract artists, and other industry venders met head-to-head to show off their best creations. We hope you had a chance to visit Leafly and our co-sponsors Bhang Chocolates and CCIA at The Valencia for the Cup kick-off party. Additionally, we'd like to congratulate our booth buddies TLC (2nd Place Hybrid, Orange Cookies) and Honey Pot Bear (1st Place Topical, Honey Pot Bear Balm) for their victories this year!
For those who couldn’t be there for a front row view, here’s a list of the champions and their winning entries.
 
   Best Sativa Flower
1st Place | Mango Tango by Elemental Seeds
2nd Place | Loud Berry Flower by Loud Seeds SL
3rd Place | Tangie by Dr. Greenthumb
 
   Best Indica Flower
1st Place | Kosher Kush by Greenwolf LA and Kush Company
2nd Place | Lorax OG by Lorax Labs from CannaSutra Collective
3rd Place | Dr. K's Paris OG Kush by Cali Natural Collective
 
   Best Hybrid Flower
1st Place | Wellness OG from the W.E.E.D. in Studio City
2nd Place | Orange Cookies from TLC Collective
3rd Place | 2010 Grizzly Genetics from Grizzly Genetics and Patients Premium Collective
 
   Best CBD Flower
1st Place | V.C.D.C. from Moxie Seeds & Extracts
2nd Place | Vitamin CBD from Growers Guild
3rd Place | Vegan Buddha Milagro from Greenwolf LA and Vegan Buddha
 
   Best Sativa Concentrate
1st Place | Red Dragon from Dabblicious Extracts
2nd Place | Space Jack from Apothecary Collective and Imperial Extracts
3rd Place | Pineapple Lemonade from Greenwolf LA, Loud Pack Extractions, and Dabblicious
 
   Best Indica Concentrate
1st Place | Lemon Walker OG from Gold Coast Extracts
2nd Place | Lemon Walker OG from Gold Coast Collection
3rd Place | Crown OG from Pissing Excellence
 
   Best Hybrid Concentrate
1st Place | Lemon Bananas from Dabblicious Extracts
2nd Place | Banangie Kosher from Greenwolf LA and Dabblicious
3rd Place | Lemon Cookies from Moxie Seeds & Extracts
 
   Best CBD Concentrate
1st Place | Ringo's Gift from POP Naturals and WCHC
2nd Place | Ringo's Gift #3 from Greenwolf LA and Loud Pack Extracts
3rd Place | CBD Simple CO2 from CannaVest
 
   Best Non-Solvent Hash
1st Place | Blissful Wizard from Incognigrow Farms
2nd Place | Cookies and Cream Cubantech Drysift from Exotic Genetix
3rd Place | Gluekie Monster from Trichome Heavy Extracts and the Source Genetics
articles.title: The 2015 SoCal Cannabis Cup Winners

articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Last weekend in San Bernardino saw another epic battle between growers in the 2014 High Times Los Angeles Cannabis Cup. California’s best heirlooms, classic favorites, and new crossbred varieties fought head-to-head in their respective categories: indica, sativa, and hybrid. In case you weren’t there to witness the history, here are the strains that took this year’s bronze, silver and gold.
BEST SATIVAS

1st Place — Red Dragon from RCP Sacramento
Characteristics of Red Dragon:

Cross between West Himalayan Kush and Utopia Haze
Sweet, fruity aroma
Induces euphoric, happy, and uplifting effects; good for social gatherings
May effectively treat depression and stress disorders
High THC may cause paranoia in anxiety-prone individuals
Grows best indoors with a 8 to 10 week flowering time


2nd Place — Silver Haze from Gold Coast Collection
Characteristics of Silver Haze:

Cross between Haze, Northern Lights, and Skunk
Fruity, pine aroma
Euphoric head and body effects; allows mental clarity
Suitable for indoor and outdoor gardens; 8 to 10 week flowering time

 

3rd Place — Crystal Coma from Alpha Medic
Characteristics of Crystal Coma:

Said to be a cross between Cheese and Skunk #1
Heavy trance-like effects; relaxing mental calm
THC content of up to 26%
Good for nighttime treatment of stress disorders, pain, and sleeplessness

BEST INDICAS

1st Place — XXX OG from Life is Good Healing
Characteristics of XXX OG:

Cross between OG Kush and XXX
Earthy, pine, and lemon aroma
Sedating and lethargic effects; heavy relaxation
May effectively treat sleeplessness, severe nausea, and chronic pain


2nd Place — Veganic LA Confidential from Private Stock for Buds and Roses
Characteristics of LA Confidential:

Cross between Afghani landrace and Southern California Afghani
Sweet, earthy, pine aroma
Cerebral euphoria and full-body relaxation
Used by patients to treat acute pain and sleep disorders

 

3rd Place — Blackwater from Terrapin Terpene Collective
Characteristics of Blackwater:

Hybrid of Mendo Purps and San Fernando Valley OG Kush
Grape, lemon, and pine aroma
Mellow cerebral experience that melts into a head-to-toe euphoric calm; may cause some mental cloudiness
Patients have reported its success in treating pain, appetite loss, multiple sclerosis, and stress disorders
Flowering time of 8 to 10 weeks

BEST HYBRIDS

1st Place — GG4 (f.k.a Gorilla Glue #4) from Standard Seed Collective
Characteristics of GG4 (f.k.a Gorilla Glue #4):

Said to come from Chemsis, Sour Dubb, and Chocolate Diesel
Chunky, conic, crystal-covered buds
56 to 60 day flowering time

2nd Place — Alpha OG from Alpha Medic
Characteristics of Alpha OG:

OG Kush phenotype
Pine aroma
Consistently tests over 20% THC when grown optimally
May treat sleep apnea, appetite and weight loss, nausea, and chronic pain


3rd Place — Redding OG from RCP Sacramento
Characteristics of Redding OG:

Long-lasting and uplifting; energizing enough for social activities
High THC content
May help with sleeplessness, appetite loss, depression, and stress

photo credit: kevinthoule via photopin cc
articles.title: The 2014 Los Angeles Cannabis Cup Winning Strains

description: Red Dragon is one exotic flower. A Barney’s Farm cross between a West Himalayan Kush and Utopia Haze (a Brazilian sativa), this hybrid is a strain for connoisseurs. Featuring a sweet, fruity aroma, Red Dragon offers consumers a truly different cannabis experience. Slightly sativa-dominant, this strain is giggly and upbeat. Great for those suffering from depression or stress, Red Dragon has a very happy and uplifting effect. Unfortunately, this strain may cause some to feel quite paranoid. If you’re prone to anxiety, Red Dragon may not be the best strain for you. This hybrid grows best indoors and has a flowering time of 8-10 weeks.
descriptionPlain: Red Dragon is one exotic flower. A Barney’s Farm cross between a West Himalayan Kush and Utopia Haze (a Brazilian sativa), this hybrid is a strain for connoisseurs. Featuring a sweet, fruity aroma, Red Dragon offers consumers a truly different cannabis experience. Slightly sativa-dominant, this strain is giggly and upbeat. Great for those suffering from depression or stress, Red Dragon has a very happy and uplifting effect. Unfortunately, this strain may cause some to feel quite paranoid. If you’re prone to anxiety, Red Dragon may not be the best strain for you. This hybrid grows best indoors and has a flowering time of 8-10 weeks.

highlightedReviews.text: The strain is the truth. For the ones who have a high tolerance (connoisseurs) it will take u bake to the time when u first got blazed, stoned, back, straight high as a monkeys ass in a tree! But... Beware it will have u set trippin make sure u got ur RedBox movies already at home. Had my wife paranoid as a damn squirrel tryna cross the street!  It will suck u in cause of the sweet kool aid after taste it leaves but a cpl of hits from the joint or a bong hit to start cause I learned the hard way and just went straight to the damn moon! It's about 3hrs past and I'm writing this review my 1st leafly review ever because it well deserved a must try I want a seed! I'm high. It feels good tho". But know the next time to just take a bong hit or just a cpl puffs cause man.........!!! Oh and it gets all powered up! Makes u giggly talkative, everything it's says it's true! Try this trust me!

name: Red Dragon
